abstract: Companies’ climate efforts do not always line up with the public’s impression of their “greenness.”
snippet: Companies’ climate efforts do not always line up with the public’s impression of their “greenness.”
lead_paragraph: If truth is only a matter of perception, then brands like Wendy’s, Levi’s and Amazon.com may be a bit luckier than, say, Nike or GE — at least as it relates to their environmental credentials.

headline.main: Report  on Green Business Practices Pits Perception Against Reality

abstract: When it comes to Henry M. Paulson’s new book, “On the Brink,” it seems there’s a little bit of disagreement over some of the particulars — and should make for an interesting conversation with General Electric’s Jeffrey Immelt next week.
snippet: When it comes to Henry M. Paulson’s new book, “On the Brink,” it seems there’s a little bit of disagreement over some of the particulars — and should make for an interesting conversation with General Electric’s Jeffrey Immelt next week.
lead_paragraph: When it comes to Henry M. Paulson Jr.’s new book, “On the Brink,” it seems there’s a little bit of disagreement over some of the particulars — and should make for an interesting conversation with Jeffrey R. Immelt next week.

headline.main: G.E. Disputes Incident in Paulson’s Book
